elements.title: Antonio Cano (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that after architect Frà Antonio Cano died of a fall from scaffolding at his new Cathedral of Our Lady of the Snows (pictured), Alberto della Marmora accused him of destroying many former basilicas?

elements.title: The Man Without Talent (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that The Man Without Talent is an I-novel, a genre of semi-autobiographical confessional literature that has been popular in Japan since the early twentieth century?

elements.title: Timo Meier (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Timo Meier became the first player in San Jose Sharks franchise history to score five goals in one game when he was 25?

elements.title: electric organs (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that electric organs are composed of stacks of specialised cells that can generate electricity?

elements.title: Ernest Roberts (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the South Australian Labor politician Ernest Roberts served two tours in South Africa during the Second Boer War?

elements.title: Circle in the Square Theatre (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the founders of New York City's Circle in the Square Theatre had a total of $320 when they leased an inn in 1951?

elements.title: Nina de Creeft Ward (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Nina de Creeft Ward worked on art that resembles corpses of extinct and endangered species to show "how people have caused a scourge to the balance of nature"?

elements.title: an old cookbook (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that an old cookbook recommends eating tiger meat to ward off tigers?
